broadwick.statistics.regression

Class SimpleLinearRegression

  • java.lang.Object
    • broadwick.statistics.regression.SimpleLinearRegression

  • public class SimpleLinearRegression
extends Object
    Estimates an ordinary least squares regression model with one independent variable. y = intercept + slope * x

    • Field Summary

      Fields

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleLinearRegression

    • Method Detail

      • addData

        public final void addData(double x,
           double y)
        Adds the observation (x,y) to the regression data set. Uses updating formulas for means and sums of squares defined in "Algorithms for Computing the Sample Variance: Analysis and Recommendations", Chan, T.F., Golub, G.H., and LeVeque, R.J. 1983, American Statistician, vol. 37, pp. 242-247, referenced in Weisberg, S. "Applied Linear Regression". 2nd Ed. 1985. Note: this uses the apache commons math library.
        Parameters:
        x - independent variable value
        y - dependent variable value

      • removeData

        public final void removeData(double x,
              double y)
        Removes the observation (x,y) from the regression data set, mirroring the addData method. The method has no effect if there are no points of data (i.e. n=0)
        Parameters:
        x - independent variable value
        y - dependent variable value

      • getSlope

        public final double getSlope()
        Returns the slope of the estimated regression line. At least two observations (with at least two different x values) must have been added before invoking this method. If this method is invoked before a model can be estimated, Double,NaN is returned.
        Returns:
        the slope of the regression line

      • getIntercept

        public final double getIntercept()
        Returns the intercept of the estimated regression line. At least two observations (with at least two different x values) must have been added before invoking this method. If this method is invoked before a model can be estimated, Double,NaN is returned.
        Returns:
        the intercept of the regression line

      • getN

        public final long getN()
        Returns the number of observations that have been added to the model.
        Returns:
        n number of observations that have been added.

      • predict

        public final double predict(double x)
        Returns the "predicted" y value associated with the supplied x value, based on the data that has been added to the model when this method is activated.

        predict(x) = intercept + slope * x

        At least two observations (with at least two different x values) must have been added before invoking this method. If this method is invoked before a model can be estimated, Double,NaN is returned.
        Parameters:
        x - input x value
        Returns:
        predicted y value

      • getR

        public final double getR()
        Returns Pearson's product moment correlation coefficient, usually denoted r. At least two observations (with at least two different x values) must have been added before invoking this method. If this method is invoked before a model can be estimated, Double,NaN is returned.

        Returns:
        Pearson's r

      • getInterceptStdErr

        public final double getInterceptStdErr()
        Returns the standard error of the intercept estimate, usually denoted s(b0). If there are fewer that three observations in the model, or if there is no variation in x, this returns Double.NaN.
        Returns:
        standard error associated with intercept estimate

      • getSlopeStdErr

        public final double getSlopeStdErr()
        Returns the standard error of the slope estimate. If there are fewer that three data pairs in the model, or if there is no variation in x, this returns Double.NaN.
        Returns:
        standard error associated with slope estimate

      • toString

        public final String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
